alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 11 at 4:01PM HST until January 12 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI...NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF MAUI LANAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A significant northwest swell moving through the island chain will gradually begin lowering through the day Thursday. The northwest (320-330 degrees) swell will shift out of the north- northwest (340 degrees) Thursday. ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 35 to 45 feet along north facing shores, and 20 to 25 feet along west facing shores of the smaller islands. Surf 8 to 12 feet along west facing shores of Big Island. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and north facing shores of Maui. West facing shores of Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Very High...Expect ocean water surging and sweeping across beaches, periodically overtopping vulnerable coastal roadways, with localized beach erosion. Wave runup could impact coastal properties and infrastructure, especially around high tide just before daybreak Thursday. Powerful longshore and rip currents will be present. Surges and strong currents inside exposed harbors could cause damage to boats due to the jostling of boats and floating docks.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
